title: What happens to a zombie underwater? Do they drown? - Quora

response.answer_text: Using the commonly accepted definition of “drowning” as suffering respiratory impairment, and eventually death, from inhalation of a liquid… Infected, but still-living beings (28 Days Later, The Crazies, etc.) would eventually drown; if they didn’t retain enough self preservation instinct to hold their breath, or surface for air. If you’re talking about “ghouls” or walking corpses (Night of the Living Dead, The Walking Dead, Return of the Living Dead, etc), they would not drown. They may or may not take in water, causing them to sink to the bottom; but there would be no asphyxiation. One would THINK that oxygen deprivation would cause damage to the brain, and disable the corpse as much as any bullet or blunt force trauma. But if we suppose that the brain has ALREADY been deprived of oxygen for an extended period, from a lack of breathing and a lack of functioning circulatory system, we are left with the assumption that some unknown force, other than oxygen, is fueling brain cell activity.

It depends a lot on whether the author/creator wants them to swim or not. In World War Z (Book), as I recall, the zombies could basically walk under water much like the skeleton pirates in the first Pirates of the Caribbean movie. In Fear the Walking Dead, our group survivors encounters zombies floating in the water. This makes sense to me, as dead bodies do float (as evidenced recently, unfortunately, by events in Rio). Those floating zombies are still dangerous and try to bite when humans are near; the water doesn’t seem to stop that. It seems to me that if there was to be “accuracy” here (and I put that in quotes because hey, we’re talking about zombies) the zombies should float since they are dead bodies. But if an author wants them to sink, I’m sure a plausible reason could be given for that.

Hi Joel, this will depend on what type of apocalypse we've gotten ourselves into. But to answer your question, there's a few scenes that I can remember from past episodes in TWD where the governor(a antagonist in a sense) tied a zombie to the bottom of a lake. He stood above on the surface watching it try and reach him. It was not drowning or choking because it was already dead, it purely wanted to eat him. Zombies are essentially dead beings unless of course like we discussed before we have a different type of apocalypse.
